instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.AVREF_SMC: What is AVREF_SMC? AVREF_SMC is a reference voltage provided to the SMC so that its sensors have a reference to work from, this should be 3.3v.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.PM_PWRBTN_L: What is PM_PWRBTN_L? PM_PWRBTN_L refers to the power button signal line. This line is used to initiate the power-on sequence of the laptop. The "L" at the end of "PM_PWRBTN_L" suggests that it is an active-low signal, meaning that when the power button is pressed, the signal is pulled low to initiate the boot sequence..
definitions.820-00138: What is 820-00138? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
threads.message:
Hi there!

Have <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works. Was pretty corroded in some places. thought i'd try my luck with the ultra sonic but same issue
So must be a sensor as I understand it?

thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
threads.message: I should mention, before it died the customer told me that it would only work with power supply plugged in. Would cut out as soon as it's disconnected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
threads.message:
Post <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> voltage, pins 2, 3, 9, 12, 13, 15, 26; only charger connected and also charger + battery.
Check resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 (ohm mode).

Also post <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and 3V42 voltage on battery only.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
threads.message:
Charger only:

pin 2 = 20v
pin 3 = 5.3v
pin 9 = 0.03
pin 12 = 3.4
pin 13 = 3.3
pin 15 = 0.06
pin 26 = 19.26v

Same result with battery and charger connected

Pin 17/18 3.3 ohms
pins 27/28 20 ohms  (seems high?)

3v42 is 3.4v on battery
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 7.3v on battery

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
threads.message:
Are you using original Apple Magsafe 2 charger?
Input voltage is too high even for 85W charger.
Try a known good one, 60W if possible.

threads.message: Whoops, i was using DCPS. i have a habbit of using this. I'll remeasure it now with the original charger

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
threads.message:
Start checking <SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL>.
Also check all sensors output form page 42.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>AVREF_SMC</SIGNAL> is good at 3.3

Nothing at <SIGNAL>PBUS_S0_VSENSE</SIGNAL> because there's no <SIGNAL>SMC_SENSOR_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>

<SIGNAL>DCIN_S5_VSENSE</SIGNAL> is 2.8V

<SIGNAL>SMC_CPU_VSENSE</SIGNAL> 0V

<SIGNAL>SMC_P1V05S0_VSENSE</SIGNAL> 0V (I'm guessing all S0 are down for obvious reasons)

<SIGNAL>SMC_CPUDDR_ISENSE</SIGNAL> 0V

<SIGNAL>SMC_P3V3S5_ISENSE</SIGNAL> 0V




How would it be possible to check sensors that rely on S0 rails if the machine isn't turning on hmmmm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
threads.message: I'm probably missing something really simple aren't I :confused:

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_VSENSE</SIGNAL> is now OK.
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_ISENSE</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL>.
No pulse at all at L7520 when <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is triggered?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_DCIN_ISENSE</SIGNAL> is 0.03v
<SIGNAL>SMC_BMON_ISENSE</SIGNAL> 0.06v

No pulse with L7520 when <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is triggered

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
threads.message: I no pulse a good sign or bad sign?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
threads.message:
It should pulse at least, when <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is triggered.
Check first if <SIGNAL>PM_PWRBTN_L</SIGNAL> reacts.

"retesting with orignal chargere"
Original Magsafe 2???
You can use bench power supply, with Magsafe 2 cable only.
Never test with Magsafe 1-->2 adapter.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
threads.message: So with the battery, when the machine is on and I unplug the magsafe, the computer will go off like it's going into sleep or hibernation. Fans will keep spinning. I'm assuming that's because it cannot detect the charge in the battery. The battery symbol from the status bar is also completely gone, if I try and enable it, it'll disable itself immediately

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
threads.message: DO NOT use anything but 85 watt OEM Magsafe 2 chargers on 2015 machines anything else causes issues. What voltage do you currently have on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> without the battery?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
threads.message:
So no battery detected on System Report too?
Did you try known good battery?
Even old one (no hold charge), just for test.

Post exact voltage for <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> with charger and battery, both connected.
Check resistance to ground at SCL/SDA lines of battery bus (diode mode); also check voltage there.

threads.message:
here's system report. 
PPbus is 7.3 battery only
8.2 battery + charger
8.2 charger only 
Sometimes it stays on for a few more seconds when i pull DC

threads.message:
SCL = 2.6v
SDA = 3.4v

diode mode both are 1.5 (red probe ground, black probe pin)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
threads.message: also, checked a few batteries, known working, all the same

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
threads.message: 8.2 volts means the SMC isn't running, and your SCL line is low which is no good. Resistance to ground on the SCL data line? Next thing would be try new ISL then next is SMC on that line if no short.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
threads.message:
"diode mode both are 1.5 (red probe ground, black probe pin)"
This is really strange.
Are you sure to check in diode mode, with red probe at ground???
You should get aprox 0.500...
SCL line is blocked; could fail SMC, or <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
threads.message:
Wait my bad, you're right. I had the probes the wrong way hahahaha 

So yes 0.500 on each pin

Is it time to replace ISL?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
threads.message:
Do you get identical value on both lines?
Less than 1% difference allowed...

Check if both <RESISTOR>R5380</RESISTOR>/81 are good.
Then change ISL; but I expect SMC issue...

resisters both perfect. will Try Isl

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
threads.message: Order 00165 donor boards pull it reball it and put it on your board

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> green/orange light, no fan spin. SMC bypass works!
threads.message:
Always pick SMC from donor board, same model...
The firmware is critical.
